subject: Re: [junit] Custom classloader
msgSnippet: Hi Johannes, I m totally on Dawids side: Why do you need custom classloading? On the other hand, if you really, really need it, you may be able to realize it
messageBody:
Hi Johannes,

I'm totally on Dawids side: Why do you need custom classloading?
On the other hand, if you really, really need it, you may be able to realize it by wrapping surefire or JUnit (or both) somehow. And there is always bytecode-manipulation. :-)
But then again: JUnit is no magic. You could even write your own very simple test execution framework for your particular problem. And you could even base it on JUnits capabilities.
Just to spray some more ideas...

Greetings,
   Malte
​
